gov.usgs.traveltime

Class Spline

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.usgs.traveltime.Spline

  • public class Spline
extends java.lang.Object
    A collection of spline interpolation routines needed for the computation of travel times.
    Author:
    Ray Buland

    • Constructor Detail

        public Spline()

    • Method Detail

      • basisSet

        public void basisSet(double[] p,
                     double[][] basis)
        Construct custom spline interpolation basis functions. These basis functions depend only on the ray parameter grid. This is a straight port of FORTRAN routine Tauspl. If p has dimension N, basis must have dimension N X 5.
        Parameters:
        p - Normalized ray parameter grid
        basis - Array to receive basis function coefficients

      • tauSpline

        public void tauSpline(double[] tau,
                      double[] xRange,
                      double[][] basis,
                      double[][] poly,
                      double[] x)
        Use the custom spline basis functions to build an interpolation for distance. Note that the interpolation depends of tau at each ray parameter, but only on distance at the end points. When finished the tau values will have been copied into the first row of poly and the interpolated distance values will be in the second row. This is a straight port of FORTRAN routine Fitspl.
        Parameters:
        tau - Normalized tau at each ray parameter grid point
        xRange - Normalized distance at each end of the ray parameter grid
        basis - Ray parameter grid basis functions computed in method basisSet
        poly - Scratch array dimensioned [3][p.length]
        x - Normalized, interpolated distance values returned
